name: Oven Baked Chicken with Rice Pilaf (Cranberry, Walnut and Apple)
description: The RICE PILAF in this recipe is sensational. Tastes savoury but with a touch of apple sweetness, herby fragrance, combined with plump cranberries, warm crunch of walnuts, and with fresh apple providing a fabulous finishing touch. The chicken is sticky from the jam (great shortcut trick) and savoury from the seasoning spices. The key step that makes a real difference is "oven sautéing" onion and garlic first. Festive inspired midweek meal to have all year round! Recipe VIDEO below.
recipeIngredient: 5  chicken thigh fillets (, bone in (about 220g / 7oz each) (Note 1))
50g (3.5 tbsp)  unsalted butter ((or sub with oil of choice))
1 1/2 cups (270g)  long grain white rice (, uncooked (Note 2))
1 cup (120g)  dried cranberries (or other dried fruit of choice)
1 cup (125g)  walnuts , roughly chopped (or other nuts of choice)
1  red apple (, cut into small dice)
1/3 cup (100g)  apricot jam ((or other jam - Note 3))

recipeInstructions.text: Use a baking dish about 22 x 33cm / 9 x 13".
recipeInstructions.name: Use a baking dish about 22 x 33cm / 9 x 13".

recipeInstructions.text: Scatter onion and garlic in baking dish, dollop butter over. Bake for 15 minutes, then remove.
recipeInstructions.name: Scatter onion and garlic in baking dish, dollop butter over. Bake for 15 minutes, then remove.

itemListElement.text: If your chicken has skin on it, remove it (just pull it off). Otherwise, the rice will be too greasy.
itemListElement.name: If your chicken has skin on it, remove it (just pull it off). Otherwise, the rice will be too greasy.

itemListElement.text: Whisk together Sticky Chicken Glaze. Add chicken, turn to coat.
itemListElement.name: Whisk together Sticky Chicken Glaze. Add chicken, turn to coat.

itemListElement.text: Add rice, apple juice, chicken broth and Rice Herbs into the pan with the onion. Stir.
itemListElement.name: Add rice, apple juice, chicken broth and Rice Herbs into the pan with the onion. Stir.

itemListElement.text: Top with chicken - it will be partly submerged. Save glaze in bowl.
itemListElement.name: Top with chicken - it will be partly submerged. Save glaze in bowl.

itemListElement.text: Cover with foil. Bake 20 minutes. Remove foil - don't worry if there's still liquid (Note 4).
itemListElement.name: Cover with foil. Bake 20 minutes. Remove foil - don't worry if there's still liquid (Note 4).

itemListElement.text: Spoon all remaining Glaze onto chicken. Optional: spray with oil (gives chicken a slightly nicer finish). Bake for another 30 - 35 minutes until chicken is browned.
itemListElement.name: Spoon all remaining Glaze onto chicken. Optional: spray with oil (gives chicken a slightly nicer finish). Bake for another 30 - 35 minutes until chicken is browned.

itemListElement.text: Remove pan from oven. Rest 5 minutes. Remove chicken, add apple, then use fork to fluff rice.
itemListElement.name: Remove pan from oven. Rest 5 minutes. Remove chicken, add apple, then use fork to fluff rice.

itemListElement.text: Serve chicken with rice pilaf, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.
itemListElement.name: Serve chicken with rice pilaf, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

review.reviewBody:
I normally cook extra at dinner to have something for next day's lunch. 

Today, I adjusted this for 8 people and then realised that I don't have a big enough oven-proof pan or casserole dish to fit 8 pieces of chicken. 

I remember that Nagi mentioned that the rice-water ratio is important, so I didn't want to put the rice in 2 dishes. I only put 3 pieces of chicken in one casserole dish with the rice and the other 5 pieces of chicken in another casserole dish. The chicken turned out good but the rice was a little al dente. I think that I should have used a measuring cup instead of the rice measuring cup that came with my rice cooker.

I still like my dinner but next time, I will remember about the measuring cup.

This was great. The rice was not what I'd describe as fluffy, but with the tangy sweetness of cranberry and the crunch of walnuts, who could be bothered to care? I was telling a friend about this dinner tonight, and he asked for the recipe immediately. I have sent so many people to Recipe Tin Eats!
I made this last night for dinner, and it might be the most delicious recipe I’ve ever made! The flavours were phenomenal, the chicken was cooked perfectly. I’ll definitely be making this again!
Just about to put it in the oven and wondering if you would put in a little bit of grated cheddar when you pull the chicken off before serving?
OK crisis averted! The liquid did get swallowed by the rice.  So if you're making this and are alarmed at the amount of liquid after the first check - don't be!  This tastes amazing.

We made this for 6 people and everyone LOVED it!  Hands down this is one of the best chicken/rice recipes that I've ever eaten!!!  We cooked the apple in with the rice (just because my husband put them in before I could stop him, lol); and we used almond slices instead of walnuts.
Hi Nagi, made this before and absolutely loved it. Do you think I can use farro instead of rice, and if so how should I adjust the cooking times with boneless skinless chicken thighs? Thanks!
another 5-star recipe, thanks Nagi! we loved it. a big skeptical at first given flavour a profile but what a pleasant surprise!
